{{Infobox military person |name = Ira Coray Abbot |image = Ira Coray Abbott.jpg |birth_date = {{Birth date|1824|12|14}} |death_date = {{Death date and age|1908|10|9|1824|12|14}} |birth_place = [[Burns, New York]] |death_place = [[Washington D.C.]] |placeofburial = [[Arlington National Cemetery]] |placeofburial_label = |placeofburial_coordinates = |nickname = |birth_name = |allegiance = [[United States]] |branch = [[United States Army]]
[[Union Army]] |serviceyears = 1861–1865 |rank = [[File:Union Army colonel rank insignia.png|35px]] [[Colonel (United States)|Colonel]]
[[File:Union Army brigadier general rank insignia.svg|35px]] [[Brevet (military)|Bvt.]] [[Brigadier general (United States)|Brigadier General]] |servicenumber = |unit = |commands = [[1st Michigan Volunteer Infantry Regiment (3 Years)|1st Michigan Infantry Regiment]] |battles = [[American Civil War]]
* [[Battle of Fredricksburg]] * [[Battle of Gettysburg]] }} '''Ira Coray Abbott''' was named captain of the [[1st Michigan Volunteer Infantry Regiment (3 Years)|1st Michigan Infantry Regiment]] on 1st May 1861.http://www.gettysburg.edu/dotAsset/cc183a2d-dd9b-485c-a4d0-bb418944380c.pdf He left the active service voluntarily on August 7, 1861 but re-entered on September 12, 1861. He was promoted to Major on April 28, 1862 and to Lieutenant Colonel on August 30, 1862. Abbott commanded the regiment at the [[Battle of Fredericksburg]] in December 1862 where he was wounded. He was promoted to colonel on March 18, 1863. At the [[Battle of Gettysburg]] the regiment was attached to the brigade of Colonel [[William S. Tilton]]; which faced the Confederate attack in the area of Stony Sill on July 2, 1863. On March 13, 1865 Abbott received a [[Brevet (military)|brevet]] promotion to Brigadier General for "bravery and meritorious service during the war." ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == For the translation from French to English on the article of Ira Coray Abbott. * [[:fr:Ira Coray Abbott]] * http://www.arlingtoncemetery.net/icabbott.html * {{findagrave|20090}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abbott, Ira Coray}} [[Category:1824 births]] [[Category:1908 deaths]] [[Category:Union Army colonels]] {{AmericanCivilWar-bio-stub}}
